批.definition: to ascertain; to act on; to criticize; to pass on; classifier for batches, lots, military flights; tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)

批件.definition: approved document; document with written instructions

批價.definition: wholesale price; to settle an account; to pay a bill

批八字.definition: to have one's fortune read; system of fortune telling based on a person's date and time of birth, according to 干支 (sexagenary cycle)

批匯.definition: to approve use of foreign currency

批卷.definition: to correct student papers; to grade exam papers

批復.definition: to reply officially to a subordinate

批改.definition: to mark (homework, exam scripts etc); to correct and criticize (an article); to check; to correct; a correction (to a piece of writing)

批文.definition: official written ruling in response to a submission; official approval in writing

批示.definition: to write comments on a report submitted by a subordinate; written comments from a superior

批註.definition: to annotate; to add marginal comments on; criticism; marginalia

批踢踢.definition: PTT, the largest terminal-based bulletin board system in Taiwan; full name: 批踢踢實業坊|批踢踢实业坊[Pi1 ti1 ti1 Shi2 ye4 Fang1]

批踢踢實業坊.pinyin: pī tī tī shí yè fāng

批轉.definition: to approve and forward; to endorse; stamp "approved for distribution"

批辦.definition: to approve and carry out; to issue approval

批郤導窾.definition: to get right to the heart of the matter (idiom)

批量購買.definition: to buy in bulk; bulk buying

批閱.definition: to read through to evaluate; to referee

批鬥.definition: to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)

批點.definition: to add critical marks or notes to a text; (fig.) to criticize
